contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Former Municipality Japan |Name= Yamauchi |JapaneseName= 山内町 |MapImage= |Since= March 1, 2006 |Currently=[[Takeo, Saga|Takeo]] |Region= [[Kyūshū]] |Prefecture= [[Saga Prefecture|Saga]] |District= [[Kishima District, Saga|Kishima]] |Area=40.91 |PopDate=November 30, 2004 |Population=9,745 |Density=238.21 |Coord=　{{coord|33|11|N|129|57|E}} |CityHallLink=[http://www.city.takeo.lg.jp/ Takeo City] }} {{nihongo|'''Yamauchi'''|山内町|Yamauchi-chō}} is a former [[towns of Japan|town]] of [[Kishima District, Saga|Kishima District]], [[Saga Prefecture]], [[Japan]]. On March 1, 2006 Yamauchi, along with the town of [[Kitagata, Saga|Kitagata]], also from [[Kishima District, Saga|Kishima District]], was merged into the expanded city of [[Takeo, Saga|Takeo]]. ==Geography== *[[Mountains]]: Mt. Kurokami, Mt. Jinroku *[[Rivers]]: Matsuura River (source) ===Adjoining municipalities=== *[[Saga Prefecture]] **[[Arita, Saga|Arita]] **[[Imari, Saga|Imari]] **[[Takeo, Saga|Takeo]] *[[Nagasaki Prefecture]] **[[Hasami, Nagasaki|Hasami]] ==History== *April 1, 1889 - The modern [[Municipalities of Japan|municipality system]] is established. The area consists of two villages: Nakato and Sumiyoshi. *April 1, 1954 - Nakato and Sumiyoshi merge to form Yamauchi Village. *March 1, 1955 - Part of Takeuchi Town is incorporated into Yamauchi Village. *September 1, 1960 - Yamauchi Village becomes Yamauchi Town (Yamauchi-Machi) ==Education== *Yamauchi Junior High School *Yamauchi Higashi Elementary School *Yamauchi Nishi Elementary School ==Transportation== ===Rail=== *[[JR Kyushu]] **[[Sasebo Line]] ***[[Nagao Station (Saga)|Nagao Station]] - [[Mimasaka Station]] ===Road=== *[[Expressways of Japan|Expressways]]: **[[Nagasaki Expressway]] ***Takeo-Kitagata Interchange *[[National highways of Japan|National highways]]: **[[Route 35 (Japan)|Route 35]] *[[Prefectural roads of Japan|Prefectural roads]]: **Saga Prefectural Route 26 ([[Imari, Saga|Imari]]-Yamauchi) **Saga Prefectural Route 28 ([[Ōchi, Saga|Ōchi]]-Yamauchi) **Saga Prefectural Route 45 ([[Ureshino, Saga|Ureshino]]-Yamauchi) ==Notable places and events== *Mt. Kurokami, Fūfu Rock *Kurokami no Roman festival *Sangyō festival *Chūō Park ==Sister cities== *{{flagicon|United States}} [[Sebastopol, California]] {{Saga Prefecture}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Saga Prefecture]]
